result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel confirms rec'd PSI & reviewed with client.  Recommendation by counsel.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 5 yrs. probation on count 1, 3 yrs on other count, w/conditions.
Sentencing hearing at 02-01-2016 02:15 pm

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of count 1 of 14CF30/max penalties and advises of count 1 in 15CF07/max. penalties; advises defendant of his constitutional rights, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to Count 1 in 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07.    Plea colloquy. Judge again advises defendant of his rights; court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas in Count 1 of 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07 and finds defendant guilty.  DRI counts 2-8 in 14CF30, DRI 15CM25, DRI 15TR38, 15TR97, Order PSI.  Trial cancelled.  Any conditions of bond are continued.  See scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 60 days out.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter resolved.  Counsel informs court of resolution.  Defendant will plead to count 1 in 14CF30 and count 1 in 15CF07, request PSI and all other files including traffic cases will be DRI along with Pierce Co. case 15CF78 which need a letter.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties close to resolution, suggest 1 more status conference.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Final pre-trial at 11-16-2015 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 12-07-2015 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on December 7 & 8, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is 2 day(s).
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for  November 16, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than August 20, 2015. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than August 20, 2015, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  ....
9 . .... 
10.  Both parties shall be present with their client and ready to go on the record no later than 8:30 on the morning of trial. 
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Bond remains as previously set.  Time limits waived for P.H.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Notice provided to parties.

Defendant Todd Mitchel Longsdorf in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a preliminary hearing.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $5000 cash.  Informs the defendant to contact the SPD immediately.  New date set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:45 am.
